questionSets.scenario: You have multiple deadlines to meet by the end of the week.
questionSets.quest: What is the best first step to handle this situation?

options.name: Prioritize tasks based on urgency and importance
Work on all tasks simultaneously
Start with the easiest tasks first
Focus on tasks you enjoy
Ignore deadlines and hope for the best

questionSets.scenario: You are often distracted by notifications while working.
questionSets.quest: How can you minimize distractions to improve focus?

options.name: Turn off notifications and set specific focus times
Respond to notifications immediately
Ignore distractions but keep notifications on
Multitask to handle distractions
Do nothing about distractions

questionSets.scenario: You have a meeting scheduled during your most productive hours.
questionSets.quest: What should you do to optimize your productivity?

options.name: Schedule high-priority tasks around the meeting
Cancel the meeting
Use the meeting as a break
Work on tasks during the meeting
Do nothing to adjust your schedule

questionSets.scenario: You feel overwhelmed by the amount of work on your plate.
questionSets.quest: What is the most effective strategy to manage your workload?

options.name: Break tasks into smaller, manageable chunks
Work non-stop until everything is done
Delegate tasks to others where possible
Avoid thinking about the workload
Complain without taking action

questionSets.scenario: You find yourself procrastinating on an important project.
questionSets.quest: What is the best way to overcome procrastination?

options.name: Set specific, achievable goals with deadlines
Work on less important tasks instead
Wait until inspiration strikes
Avoid thinking about the project
Ignore the project entirely

questionSets.scenario: You have trouble tracking your daily tasks and deadlines.
questionSets.quest: What tool or method would help you manage your time better?

options.name: Use a planner or digital calendar
Rely on memory alone
Ask others to remind you
Make a mental list each morning
Ignore task tracking altogether

questionSets.scenario: You spend too much time on low-priority tasks.
questionSets.quest: What is the best way to allocate your time?

options.name: Focus on high-priority tasks first

Do tasks in random order
Avoid prioritizing tasks

questionSets.quest: What should you focus on to maximize your preparation?

options.name: Identify key points and practice delivery

Review unrelated material
Procrastinate and hope for the best
Skip preparation altogether

Ignore stress and hope it goes away
